metadata.name: M1DN16H7 5UN
metadata.description:
Infrared can be confusing... Many times, I've been asked if it was day or night, winter or summer...

This piece is a timeless composition using infrared light. The result is a black-and-white image that confuses the viewer by not knowing if it's taken by day or night.


// Process

The foreground and the tree have been captured around 12 am, at 850nm, under a bright sun. The stars around 12 pm, in visible light, during a dark night. The filter  IR 850 nm, lets only infrared light hit the sensor and create a true black-and-white image. The bright blue sky, which doesn't reflect infrared, appears dark and was perfect to add the Milky Way.


// About the NFT

Artist's name: Jonas Hangartner | J0n45.eth  
Title: M1DN16H7 5UN (pronounce Midnight Sun)  
Edition: 1/1

Availability: NFT and print (edition of 10) 
Resolution: 3744 x 5616 px  
Coordinates: 46.583614, 6.469248


// About the artist

Hi, my name is Jonas Hangartner, a photographer from Switzerland. My goal is to reveal another reality that surrounds us through a light invisible to the naked eye. Using the infrared spectrum to capture nature beyond what we see.


// Extended Editorial License

Can be displayed privately, in commercial and non-commercial settings, or in groups with an unlimited number of participants.
